text: Thanks Katie, much appreciated :slightly_smiling_face: I like how Monzo handle this with their business account roadmap (although, some really rough dates would be incredibly helpful) <https://trello.com/b/FNEatI34/monzo-business-account>

According to this document we can (scroll to section 6)
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/drag-and-drop-areas>

"The various components of drag and drop areas, sections, columns, rows and modules all have classes which can be styled using CSS. The editable styles and options for these components can be set using CSS rather than HubL. For example, default padding can be set on dnd_sections with the CSS:"
Hi all - wondering if its safe to build DND landing page templates for a client or should I stick to building normal custom coded templates until we're out of BETA; Thoughts? <@U8THBCFC4>
I’d say the DnD HubL is pretty well finalized and you’re safe to build with it, but <@U6W3H6YN8> may know better!
